搖.definition: to shake; to rock; to row; to crank

搖人.definition: to call people over; to rally people together

搖光.definition: Alkaid; Eta Ursae Majoris in the Big Dipper

搖尾乞憐.definition: lit. to behave like a dog wagging its tail, seeking its master's affection (idiom); fig. to fawn on sb; to bow and scrape; to grovel

搖手.definition: to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture); crank handle

搖搖欲墜.definition: tottering; on the verge of collapse

搖擺.definition: to sway; to wobble; to waver

搖旗吶喊.definition: to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on; to give support to

搖晃.definition: to rock; to shake; to sway

搖曳.definition: to sway gently (as in the wind); (of a flame) to flicker

搖櫓.definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)

搖櫓船.definition: boat propelled by a yuloh (a single sculling oar)

搖滾.definition: rock 'n' roll (music); to rock; to fall off

搖獎.definition: to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)

搖船.definition: to scull; to row a boat

搖身.definition: lit. to shake one's body; refers to abrupt transformation; same as 搖身一變|摇身一变

搖身一變.definition: to change shape in a single shake; fig. to take on a new lease of life

搖錢樹.definition: legendary tree that sheds coins when shaken; (fig.) source of easy money

搖頭擺尾.definition: to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom); to be well pleased with oneself; to have a lighthearted air
